burrow.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make a hole or passage in the ground
burrow.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Mother turtles burrow into the sand to lay their eggs.
burrow.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to press your body close to someone or under something because you want to get warm or feel safe
burrow.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The child stirred and burrowed deeper into the bed.
She burrowed her head into his shoulder.
burrow.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to search for something that is hidden in a container or under other things
burrow.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Helen burrowed in her bag for a handkerchief.
burrow.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or fox as a place to live
